intro: Lotononis pulchella, commonly known as the pretty lotonon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
